image.altText: A close-up of a woman with a serious expression

props.synopsis: More than 500 current and former supermarket workers across regional South Australia will receive $5.5 million in back pay, after securing what their union describes as "one of the biggest retail underpayment settlements" in the state's history.

title.children: More than 500 supermarket workers to share in $5.5m after court settlement

image.altText: Artist stands over table of his artwork, motioning at them with his hands

props.synopsis: Cole White lives with Down syndrome and is often non-verbal — but through art, he has found a new way to express himself.

title.children: Cole started creating art to decorate his mum's house. Now he's had his first solo exhibition

image.altText: GettyImages-2223761764

props.synopsis: Adelaide leap into the top four with a hard fought win over Melbourne, while Sydney have kept a faint heartbeat in their season after defeating Fremantle.

title.children: Crows hopeful star has avoided ACL after knee injury

image.altText: A fish with a flat head, long tail, brown stripes across its back and red rash, on the beach

props.synopsis: An algal bloom killing marine life in South Australia is persisting despite winter conditions. So what do we know about the bloom, and — perhaps more importantly — what don't we know?

title.children: What we know about the ecological disaster washing up on SA's coast

image.altText: A Port Adelaide player grimaces as he is helped from the ground by medical staff during an AFL game.

props.synopsis: The defending premiers Brisbane get the job done against Port Adelaide at the Gabba, with a potentially serious injury to Sam Powell-Pepper, while Hawthorn beat the Saints at Docklands.

title.children: Power coach gets emotional after Powell-Pepper injury in Lions loss

image.altText: The headquarters of oil and gas company Santos.

props.synopsis: There are fears for around 50 jobs at the regional SA site as the company looks to "simplify" operations.

title.children: Regional SA jobs at risk as Santos reviews Port Bonython site

image.altText: French bulldog in a blue sweater held by a woman, standing near steps and open outdoor spaces under clear skies

props.synopsis: A cold start to winter encourages people to put clothes on their dogs, but a vet has noticed a spate of wounds related to ill-fitting straps, prompting a warning to be careful what you buy.

title.children: Warning as dogs suffer 'horrific' injuries from jackets and jumpers

image.altText: A design proposal for the former Glenside hospital site.

props.synopsis: The South Australian government has approved a developer's controversial bid to build apartments of up to 20 storeys in Adelaide's inner-eastern suburbs.

title.children: Rezoning approved for 20-storey apartments outside Adelaide CBD

image.altText: A hand holds a remote pointed towards a large TV.

props.synopsis: Earlier this week its free-to-air channels were replaced with red screens when Seven West Media and WIN TV failed to agree on how much Seven would pay WIN to broadcast its programming.

title.children: Channel 7 back on air in regional SA, NSW after securing new WIN deal

image.altText: Woman with respiratory illness, blowing her nose into handkerchief.

props.synopsis: Reported flu cases across South Australia have spiked 70 per cent this year, with more than 1,000 cases in the last week alone. It has coincided with another rise in ambulance ramping, which soared in June to its second-highest level on record.

title.children: 'Alarming' spike in SA flu cases as ambulance ramping soars again

image.altText: A photo of a woman taken from the side. She's holding a cane and sitting on a stool with her amputated legs showing.

props.synopsis: After Gill Hicks was rescued from the wreckage of a tube train following London's 7/7 terrorist attacks in 2005, she was so severely injured her hospital identification wristband read, "One unknown — estimated female".

title.children: Australian survivor of London 7/7 attacks marks 20 anniversary with 'performance of a lifetime'

image.altText: A young girl crying with her head in her hands outside a camp accommodation building.

props.synopsis: Children from a Christian summer camp are among those still missing after flash flooding killed dozens of people in Texas.

title.children: Disaster declared as flood death toll rises in Texas

image.altText: A computer screen with notes written under sub-headings.

props.synopsis: AI tools are becoming more prevalent in healthcare, helping overworked doctors to carry the workload. But experts say there are real risks, including accuracy and data protection.

title.children: Accuracy a major concern as more doctors, hospitals turn to AI to help ease the workload

image.altText: Australian players Sam Konstas, Beau Webster, Mitchell Starc and Pat Cummins celebrate a Test victory over West Indies.

props.synopsis: Australia bowls out the West Indies for 143 to secure a 133 run second Test victory and take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the series.

title.children: Australia retains Frank Worrell Trophy with dominant victory over West Indies

image.altText: Oscar Piastri walks from his car in parc ferme with his head bowed

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri has been denied victory in the Formula 1 British Grand Prix after being handed a 10-second penalty for a safety car infringement.

title.children: Controversial penalty costs Piastri victory as championship lead is cut

image.altText: Men posing with a man in a hospital bed

props.synopsis: A doctor who amputated the leg of a Lithuanian rafter to free him from rapids in Tasmania's Franklin River has been awarded the Life Saving Cross in Vilnius.

title.children: Franklin River rescue doctor receives international medal for role in saving rafter

image.altText: RSPCA Queensland spokesman Michael Beatty

props.synopsis: The colourful Queensland media figure carved out a successful career as a current affairs reporter, covering royal weddings, the downfall of the Marcos regime and the Brixton riots before joining the RSPCA in 2004.

title.children: Veteran journalist and RSPCA spokesman Michael Beatty dies aged 76

image.altText: 2025-06-06T060538Z_340498249_RC2JSEAYFASX_RTRMADP_3_USA-TRUMP-MUSK-FRUSTRATION

props.synopsis: Elon Musk's announcement comes after the president signed his signature bill into law on Friday, a move Mr Musk says will bankrupt the country.

title.children: Musk-Trump feud escalates as Tesla boss forms the 'America Party'

image.altText: Man stand next to stone wall

props.synopsis: Male educators say they’re feeling isolated as the fallout from the latest childcare abuse allegations raises tensions in workplaces.

title.children: 'I felt that judgement': Male childcare workers now worry about their jobs

image.altText: Silhouette of a woman's head coloured purple with small puzzle pieces falling out of the back

props.synopsis: After witnessing my mum's cognitive decline and with dementia now the leading cause of death for Australian women, I can't help but wonder: Will I be among them?

title.children: My mother was diagnosed with dementia. I'm doing everything to minimise my risk

image.altText: Jordan Thompson of Australia leans on the net

props.synopsis: Australian Jordan Thompson retires from his round-of-16 match at Wimbledon against Taylor Fritz with a back injury, while Cruz Hewitt wins his first match in the Wimbledon junior singles.

title.children: Lleyton Hewitt's son wins Wimbledon debut as Thompson forced to retire

image.altText: A man dressed in black and a Jewish skullcap walks up some stairs beside a wooden door that is fire damaged.

props.synopsis: A New South Wales man is due to face court in Melbourne over a fire at a synagogue that has drawn condemnation from Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanhyahu.

title.children: Police lay charges over synagogue fire amid condemnation of alleged attack

image.altText: lions lying down

props.synopsis: It's understood the woman lost an arm after the incident at the Darling Downs Zoo near Toowoomba.

title.children: Woman was watching keepers at work when she was bitten by lion

image.altText: An old man smiling

props.synopsis: Television chef, author and artist Peter Russell-Clarke, known for his catchphrase "g'day", has died, aged 89.

title.children: 'A very big character': Celebrity chef Peter Russell-Clarke dies aged 89

image.altText: Two messages on a phone both say "hey".

props.synopsis: Users of popular same-sex hook-up and dating apps are being targeted by violent offenders, but many victims fear reporting out of fears of exposure.

title.children: Catfishing teens behind rise in homophobic attacks

image.altText: Allan Alaalatoa of the Wallabies looks on during the Test against Fiji.

props.synopsis: Mastering the basics will be a priority for Joe Schmidt's Wallabies squad after a scratchy performance against Fiji ahead of the blockbuster three-Test series against the British and Irish Lions.

title.children: Why an F-word is on the Wallabies' lips ahead of Lions Test series

image.altText: Daniel is wearing a black suit with a white button up shirt

props.synopsis: The National NAIDOC Awards have wrapped up for another year. Here's your guide to the winners list.

title.children: Daniel Hunt wins coveted NAIDOC Person of the Year

image.altText: An old Tibetan man in red robes leans over to pat a koala, held by a young girl. A blond4e woman and a small boy sit beside them

props.synopsis: To Tibetans all over the world, His Holiness is a hugely important spiritual and political leader.

title.children: The Dalai Lama turns 90 and delivers Tibetan Buddhists an answer

image.altText: A concept drawing of the chocolate experience showing a large chocolate fountain.

props.synopsis: The idea seemed to come out of the blue — $12 million for the "world's tallest chocolate fountain" at a new Cadbury tour in Hobart. Documents show how a tourism developer got government grants and landed the promise from Premier Jeremy Rockliff.

title.children: Where is the 'chocolate fountain' promised to Tasmanians at the 2024 election?

image.altText: Thailand's Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra smiles and waves through a rolled-down car window.

props.synopsis: Paetongtarn Shinawatra is a photogenic, wealthy daughter of a powerful political family that has been at the top of Thai politics. But now she has fallen from grace.

title.children: The dynasty that has dominated Thailand may have run out of power

image.altText: A room full of people performing tactile Auslan and smiling

props.synopsis: Very little progress has been made on "once-in-a-generation" disability reforms since they were first announced in 2023, leaving many in the sector concerned some people could be left behind.

title.children: As the government clamps the NDIS, is this the future of disability support?

image.altText: Tongan women in traditional dress sitting on floor holding strands of plant over a tanoa

props.synopsis: Demand for kava is growing so large in Australia that Woolworths has started stocking the beverage, known for its calming effects. But Pacific leaders say the crop's success comes with problems.

title.children: In the Pacific, 'who has kava is king' but some fear it's hurting families

image.altText: Ben O'Connor crashes with his buike in the air and the rider on the ground

props.synopsis: Ben O'Connor is a late faller on a chaotic first day of the Tour de France as two key contenders lose time after a split and two riders abandon the race after crashes.

title.children: 'Banged-up' Ben O'Connor crashes on 'crazy' first day of Tour
